We have our own unique way of pronouncing things. 3. Currency, ATMs and payments Switzerland uses the Swiss Franc (CHF), not the Euro. While some places accept Euros, the exchange rate is rarely in your favor. The Swiss banking system is well-developed and ATMs (known locally as Bancomats) are widely available in cities, towns and even many rural areas. Most ATMs accept major international credit and debit cards. While credit cards are commonly used, some smaller businesses, mountain huts and rural guesthouses may only accept cash. (Read more about travel money in Switzerland here.) Contactless payment is widely used, so mobile payments like Apple Pay and Google Pay work in most places.
